intro: Ceratochloa cathartica, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Ceratochloa cathartica is often found in disturbed sites and can serve as an indicator species for wetland habitats.
